properties.areaDesc: Mississippi, MO; New Madrid, MO; Fulton, KY
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:59AM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following rivers in Illinois...Missouri...
Kentucky...

Mississippi River at Cape Girardeau...Thebes and New Madrid...

.Current and expected heavy rainfall today through Saturday evening,
combined with expected rain and snow melt from the middle and upper
Mississippi Valley later next week will lead to sharper rises on
the Mississippi River at Cape Girardeau, Thebes, and New Madrid. These
locations are expected to rise above flood stage early next week.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Mississippi River at New Madrid.
* from Monday evening until further notice.
* At 11:00 AM Friday the stage was 31.8 feet.
* Flood Stage is 34.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Monday evening and continue to
rise to near 37.5 feet by Friday evening, January 17th.
* Impact...At 38.0 Feet...Heavy agricultural damage begins.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
